Posted By: Lege (11/8/2009 2:00:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ SoulShatterer:
  
   
Not true. At a certain point, the -1/-1 counters will reduce this creature's toughness to 0, meaning this creature would get sent to the graveyard by default.
  
   
@ Treima:
  
   
As a kithkin creature, it does have some advantages over Samite Healer. [Ballyrush Banneret](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ballyrush Banneret) could reduce this one's cost to {W} if you had 4 of them out. Also, all a -1/-1 counter is is a counter that lowers power and toughness. This creature just needs the same care that a creature with Persist, such as [Twilight Shepherd](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twilight Shepherd), needs: [Mark of Eviction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mark of Eviction)! At the point where he has only 1 toughness due to the 3 counters you put on him, you place the mark on him and he comes back to your hand, and the counters go away. Then, summon him again, use him as a blocker, then abuse his ability again.
posts.html:
@ SoulShatterer:

Not true. At a certain point, the -1/-1 counters will reduce this creature's toughness to 0, meaning this creature would get sent to the graveyard by default.

@ Treima:

As a kithkin creature, it does have some advantages over Samite Healer. Ballyrush Banneret could reduce this one's cost to {W} if you had 4 of them out. Also, all a -1/-1 counter is is a counter that lowers power and toughness. This creature just needs the same care that a creature with Persist, such as Twilight Shepherd, needs: Mark of Eviction! At the point where he has only 1 toughness due to the 3 counters you put on him, you place the mark on him and he comes back to your hand, and the counters go away. Then, summon him again, use him as a blocker, then abuse his ability again.

posts.post_content:
@ Baconradar  
Use with [Daru Spiritualist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Daru Spiritualist) and then sac it to [Starlit Sanctum](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Starlit Sanctum) to gain an arbitrarily large (read: infinite) amount of life. And in addition to that, all your clerics get arbitrarily large toughness until the end of the turn as well.
